name: IFEval
description: Developed a Large Language Model (LLM) evaluation framework in Clojure based on the work done by Google and Yale University.

name: ASCII Chess
description: Developed Chess. It includes the implementation of all standard Chess rules with multiplayer support!

name: GoodEats
description: Developed a full-stack web application using React and Node.js for users to obtain nutritional information from images of food items.

name: Photo Library (Desktop)
description: Developed a Java FX photo application for managing photos in albums, implementing features such as user login, album creation, photo tagging, search functionality, and user management, following best practices for code organization and version control using Bitbucket.

name: Photo Library (Android)
description: Developed the same Photo Library project for the Android phone.

name: Malloc/Free Clone
description: Reinvent the wheel by creating my own memory allocation and deallocation library in C.

name: Concurrent File Formatter
description: Created, tested, and documented a command-line interface (CLI) in C that uses producer-consumer threading to concurrently format (word wrap) text files in multiple directories and subdirectories.

name: Posix Thread Clone
description: Designed and benchmarked a custom C library to implement Posix Threads (pthread) in user space, including thread mutex, scheduler, and essential thread functionality.

name: Virtual Memory
description: Developed a library in C to simulate virtual memory. I implemented a 2-level page table to store the virtual address translations, and optimized page table lookup with a translation lookaside buffer

name: FUSE based File System
description: Designed a file system using FUSE (Filesystem in Userspace). I implemented basic file system operations like ls, touch, mkdir, cd.
